alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Northern Gila County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 12 at 1:20PM MST until February 15 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TUESDAY TO 6 AM MST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Expect scattered rain and snow showers through the day Monday. Then, a much more serious storm, containing moderate to heavy snow, strong winds and sharply colder temperatures, will arrive by later Tuesday morning, lasting through Tuesday night. Snow totals of 5 to 10 inches are expected at the higher elevations, with 1 to 5 inches between 5000 and 6000 feet. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Buffalo Pass, Chinle, Dilkon, Eagar-Springerville, Ganado, Holbrook, Kayenta, Kykotsmovi, Payson, Pine-Strawberry, Saint Johns, Shonto, Snowflake-Taylor and Window Rock. * WHEN...From noon Tuesday to 6 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. Snow forecast from noon Tuesday to 6 AM Wednesday: Buffalo Pass 6 to 10 inches Chinle 2 to 4 inches Dilkon 2 to 4 inches Eagar-Sprgrvlle 4 to 6 inches Ganado 4 to 8 inches Holbrook 1 to 3 inches Kayenta 2 to 4 inches Kykotsmovi 1 to 3 inches Payson 4 to 8 inches Pine-Strawberry 8 to 12 inches Saint Johns 3 to 5 inches Shonto 4 to 6 inches Snowflake-Taylr 4 to 6 inches Window Rock 5 to 9 inches .
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
